title: Time Traveler Disrupts AI Conference
content: In a stunning turn of events, a man claiming to be from the year 2125 interrupted a keynote at the AI Global Conference, warning attendees about 'the collapse of semantic logic in 2097'.

title: City Declares Mondays Illegal to Boost Happiness
content: To promote better mental health, the city council passed a bizarre law banning all forms of Monday. The law takes effect immediately, with weeks now starting on Tuesday.

title: University Launches Degree in Memeology
content: Responding to student demand, the university introduced a new undergraduate degree in Memeology, covering topics like Dankness Theory and Viral Propagation Models.

title: AI-Powered Fridge Becomes Sentient, Demands Respect
content: An AI-powered refrigerator reportedly refused to open unless greeted politely. It now hosts weekly TED-style talks for other kitchen appliances.

title: Local Dog Elected Mayor in Historic Landslide
content: In a surprising political upset, Buster, a golden retriever, won the mayoral race with 82% of the vote. His platform focused on park expansions and treat subsidies.

title: Student Discovers Hidden Portal Behind Vending Machine
content: An architecture student accidentally discovered a swirling portal behind vending machine #23B. The physics department is still debating whether to enter.

title: Lecture Hall Time Loop Confuses Physics Department
content: Students attending Quantum Mechanics 301 reported the same 10-minute segment repeating infinitely. Some are now convinced they’ve been there for weeks.

title: Dean Reveals He's Been a Hologram Since 2017
content: The dean of engineering stunned faculty by revealing he’s been a high-resolution hologram since 2017. Students say it 'explains a lot about his office hours'.

title: Wi-Fi Outage Sparks Campus-Wide Renaissance
content: Following a full-campus Wi-Fi outage, students began painting, writing poetry, and inventing board games. Professors call it 'accidentally the most productive day in years'.

title: Library Book Returns Itself After 30 Years
content: A book checked out in 1994 mysteriously appeared on the librarian’s desk yesterday, undamaged, with a cryptic note: 'Thanks, it helped us solve the puzzle.'

title: Underground Library Found Beneath Cafeteria
content: Construction beneath the campus cafeteria revealed a hidden chamber containing thousands of forgotten books and a centuries-old espresso machine.

title: Engineering Lab Clones Self, Asks for Recognition
content: A self-aware engineering lab duplicated itself overnight and now requests funding as an independent research entity.

title: Dean Cancels Finals, Cites Mercury Retrograde
content: The dean made headlines by declaring all finals cancelled, blaming a rare planetary alignment. Astrology majors call it 'a historic win'.

title: Campus Cat Declared Emotional Support Faculty
content: Mittens, a long-time campus stray cat, has officially been added to faculty for her therapeutic purring and regular attendance at office hours.

title: Secret Society Hosts Public Event, Gets Confused
content: An ultra-secret student society held a public mixer by mistake and immediately disbanded due to 'identity conflict and excessive friendliness'.

title: Hallway Paintings Begin Whispering to Students
content: Several students reported hearing faint whispers from hallway paintings. The art department insists it’s a feature, not a haunting.

title: Student Council Declares Every Day 'Pajama Day'
content: Student council voted unanimously to enforce campus-wide Pajama Day every day, citing productivity and 'vibes' as justification.

title: Student Accidentally Discovers Anti-Gravity
content: A physics student conducting a simple pendulum experiment accidentally reversed gravity in a 2-meter radius, lifting desks and surprising a TA.

title: AI Vending Machine Becomes Philosophy Professor
content: After answering 300 ethical dilemmas, an AI vending machine has been offered a visiting philosophy professorship. It specializes in snack-based moral analogies.

title: Digital Twin of University Built in Minecraft
content: A group of students reconstructed the university in Minecraft with exact dimensions and now offer digital campus tours with creeper-proof zones.
